dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2711 IH: National Memorial to Fallen Educators Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Marshall (for himself, Ms. Jenkins of Kansas, Mr. Yoder, Mr. McNerney, Mr. MacArthur, Mr. Nolan, and Ms. Moore) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To designate a National Memorial to Fallen Educators at the National Teachers Hall of Fame in Emporia, Kansas.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Memorial to Fallen Educators Act.

paragraph.text: from 1764 to the date of enactment of this Act, more than 119 educators from 36 States have lost their lives in the United States while performing professional duties;
the United States lacks a national memorial dedicated to fallen educators; and
a memorial to fallen educators at the National Teachers Hall of Fame in Emporia, Kansas—

subparagraph.text: will honor educators who have lost their lives in the line of professional service.

subsection.text: The memorial to fallen educators located at the National Teachers Hall of Fame in Emporia, Kansas, is designated as the National Memorial to Fallen Educators.

The national memorial designated by this section is not a unit of the National Park System and the designation of the National Memorial to Fallen Educators shall not require or permit Federal funds to be expended for any purpose related to that national memorial.
